snippet: The fillet on your plate is more likely to be farmed these days, but that doesn’t mean wild fish are off the hook.
abstract: Editorial highlights United Nations projection that in 2013 humans will for first time consume more farmed fish than wild-caught fish; notes that while booming aquaculture has many benefits, there are attendant risks; warns success of farmed fish cannot blind world's political leaders to the need to protect the wild fish that remain.
lead_paragraph: The fillet on your plate is more likely to be farmed these days, but that doesn’t mean wild fish are off the hook.
